answerText: eutectic point [10] Similar to the eutectic point, this is a point that exists on a phase diagram in which the homogenous mixture directly meets a singular solid phase.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Carnegie Mellon University and University of Central Florida | 10 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In a phase diagram, it is the point that exists at the boundary between the liquid phase and the homogenous mixture phase for a compound. For 10 points each:   [10] What is this point that derives its name from the Greek for "easily melted"?
